alert.note: Alert for Grand (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 13 at 3:51PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Utah, within Grand County, along the Dolores River from the UT/CO stateline to the confluence with the Colorado River. * WHEN...Until noon MDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from snowmelt. Low-water crossings may be inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 344 PM MDT, gage reports indicated the potential for accelerated flow due to recent snowmelt. Flooding is expected to begin this evening in the warned area. - This includes portions of the following streams and drainages... Fisher Creek, Waring Canyon, Beaver Creek, Dolores River and Granite Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Southeastern Grand County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
